gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum¶

This module is for computation of theoretical amplitude spectrum methods.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.anelastic_attenuation(freq, dist, model='REA99')[source]¶

Effect of anelastic attenuation.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • dist (float) – Distance (km).

  • model (str) – Name of model for anelastic attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999) - ‘none’ for no anelastic attenuation

Returns

Array of aneastic attenuation factor.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.brune(freq, moment, stress_drop=150, RP=0.55, VHC=0.7071068, FSE=2.0, shear_vel=3.7, density=2.8, R0=1.0, output_units='ACC')[source]¶

Compute Brune (1970, 1971) earthquake source spectrum.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • moment (float) – Earthquake moment (dyne-cm).

  • stress_drop (float) – Earthquake stress drop (bars).

  • RP (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components.

  • VHC (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components 1 / np.sqrt(2.0).

  • FSE (float) – Free surface effect.

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

  • density (float) – Density at source (gm/cc).

  • R0 – Reference distance (km).

Returns

Array of source spectra.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.brune_f0(moment, stress_drop, shear_vel=3.7)[source]¶

Compute Brune’s corner frequency.

Parameters

  • moment (float) – Earthquake moment (dyne-cm).

  • stress_drop (float) – Earthquake stress drop (bars).

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

Returns

Brune corner frequency (Hz).

Return type

float

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.brune_stress(moment, f0, shear_vel=3.7)[source]¶

Compute Brune’s stress drop.

Parameters

  • moment (float) – Earthquake moment (dyne-cm).

  • f0 (float) – Brune corner frequency (Hz).

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

Returns

Brune stress drop (bars).

Return type

float

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.crustal_amplification(freq, model='BT15')[source]¶

Crustal amplificaiton model.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • model (str) – Name of model for crustal amplification. Currently only supported value: - ‘BT15’ for Boore and Thompson (2015) - ‘none’ for no crustal amplification model.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.finite_fault_factor(magnitude, model='BT15')[source]¶

Finite fault factor for converting Rrup to an equivalent point source distance.

Parameters

  • magnitude (float) – Earthquake moment magnitude.

  • model (str) – Which model to use; currently only suppport “BT15”.

Returns

Adjusted distance.

Return type

float

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.fit_spectra(st, origin, kappa=0.035, RP=0.55, VHC=0.7071068, FSE=2.0, density=2.8, shear_vel=3.7, R0=1.0, moment_factor=100, min_stress=0.1, max_stress=10000)[source]¶

Fit spectra vaying stress_drop and moment.

Parameters

  • st (StationStream) – Stream of data.

  • origin (ScalarEvent) – ScalarEvent object.

  • kappa (float) – Site diminution factor (sec). Typical value for active cruststal regions is about 0.03-0.04, and stable continental regions is about 0.006.

  • RP (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components.

  • VHC (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components 1 / np.sqrt(2.0).

  • FSE (float) – Free surface effect.

  • density (float) – Density at source (gm/cc).

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

  • R0 (float) – Reference distance (km).

  • moment_factor (float) – Multiplicative factor for setting bounds on moment, where the moment (from the catalog moment magnitude) is multiplied and divided by moment_factor to set the bounds for the spectral optimization.

  • min_stress (float) – Min stress for fit search (bars).

  • max_stress (float) – Max stress for fit search (bars).

Returns

StationStream with fitted spectra parameters.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.geometrical_spreading(freq, dist, model='REA99')[source]¶

Effect of geometrical spreading.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • dist (float) – Distance (km).

  • model (str) – Name of model for geometric attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999)

Returns

Array of anelastic attenuation factor.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.magnitude_from_moment(moment)[source]¶

Compute moment from moment magnitude.

Parameters

moment (float) – Seismic moment (dyne-cm).

Returns

Moment magnitude.

Return type

float

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.model(x, freq, dist, kappa, RP=0.55, VHC=0.7071068, FSE=2.0, shear_vel=3.7, density=2.8, R0=1.0, gs_mod='REA99', q_mod='REA99', crust_mod='BT15')[source]¶

Piece together a model of the ground motion spectrum.

Parameters

  • x (tuple) – Tuple of the natural log of moment (dyne-cm) and the natural log of stress drop (bars).

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • dist (float) – Distance (km).

  • kappa (float) – Site diminution factor (sec). Typical value for active cruststal regions is about 0.03-0.04, and stable continental regions is about 0.006.

  • RP (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components.

  • VHC (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components 1 / np.sqrt(2.0).

  • FSE (float) – Free surface effect.

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

  • density (float) – Density at source (gm/cc).

  • R0 (float) – Reference distance (km).

  • gs_model (str) – Name of model for geometric attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999)

  • q_model (str) – Name of model for anelastic attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999) - ‘none’ for no anelastic attenuation

  • crust_mod (str) – Name of model for crustal amplification. Currently only supported value: - ‘BT15’ for Boore and Thompson (2015) - ‘none’ for no crustal amplification model.

Returns

Array of spectra model.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.moment_from_magnitude(magnitude)[source]¶

Compute moment from moment magnitude.

Parameters

magnitude (float) – Moment magnitude.

Returns

Seismic moment (dyne-cm).

Return type

float

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.path(freq, dist, gs_mod='REA99', q_mod='REA99')[source]¶

Path term, including geometric and anelastic attenuation.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • dist (float) – Distance (km).

  • gs_model (str) – Name of model for geometric attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999)

  • q_model (str) – Name of model for anelastic attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999) - ‘none’ for no anelastic attenuation

Returns

Array of path effects.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.site(freq, kappa, crust_mod='BT15')[source]¶

Site term, including crustal amplificaiton and kappa.

Parameters

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies for computing spectra (Hz).

  • kappa (float) – Site diminution factor (sec). Typical value for active cruststal regions is about 0.03-0.04, and stable continental regions is about 0.006.

  • crust_mod (str) – Name of model for crustal amplification. Currently only supported value: - ‘BT15’ for Boore and Thompson (2015) - ‘none’ for no crustal amplification model.

gmprocess.waveform_processing.spectrum.spectrum_cost(x, freq, obs_spec, fmin, fmax, dist, kappa, RP, VHC=0.7071068, FSE=2.0, shear_vel=3.7, density=2.8, R0=1.0, gs_mod='REA99', q_mod='REA99', crust_mod='BT15')[source]¶

Function to compute RMS log residuals for optimization.

Parameters

  • x (tuple) – Tuple of the natural log of moment (dyne-cm) and the natural log of stress drop (bars).

  • freq (array) – Numpy array of frequencies (Hz).

  • obs_spec (array) – Numpy array of observed Fourier spectral amplitudes.

  • fmin (float) – Minimum frequency to use in computing residuals.

  • fmax (float) – Maximum frequency to use in computing residuals.

  • dist (float) – Distance (km).

  • kappa (float) – Site diminution factor (sec). Typical value for active cruststal regions is about 0.03-0.04, and stable continental regions is about 0.006.

  • RP (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components.

  • VHC (float) – Partition of shear-wave energy into horizontal components 1 / np.sqrt(2.0).

  • FSE (float) – Free surface effect.

  • shear_vel (float) – Shear-wave velocity at source (km/s).

  • density (float) – Density at source (gm/cc).

  • R0 (float) – Reference distance (km).

  • gs_model (str) – Name of model for geometric attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999)

  • q_model (str) – Name of model for anelastic attenuation. Currently only supported value: - ‘REA99’ for Raoof et al. (1999) - ‘none’ for no anelastic attenuation

  • crust_mod (str) – Name of model for crustal amplification. Currently only supported value: - ‘BT15’ for Boore and Thompson (2015) - ‘none’ for no crustal amplification model.

Returns

Sum of squared logarithmic residuals.

Return type

float
